events.comment:
Handle leaderboards.
To create a leaderboard, make sure your game is registered in Home > Profile > Games Dashboard and then, click on "Manage game" > Leaderboards. When a leaderboard is created, it should be available in the actions.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TweenIntoView
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Tween object into position from off screen, to create a polished visual effect.
description: Tween UI objects into position from off screen, or from a set position, to create a polished visual effect.

When the object is first created in the game scene, or if they exist at the beginning of the scene, they will be moved a set distance from where they were originally placed, and tween back to the position over a set duration.
Create the object to tween it into the game scene, and use the "TweenOut" action to tween the object back in the direction it came from, and delete the object when the tween ends.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Tween UI objects into position from off screen, to create a polished visual effect.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: TweenIntoView

eventsFunctions.name: TweenIn

eventsFunctions.name: TweenOut

propertyDescriptors.label: Manually set the distance to of the tween
propertyDescriptors.description: Leave this value at 0 to tween the object in from outside of the screen.
propertyDescriptors.name: TweenDistance

propertyDescriptors.label: Tween in the object when first created
propertyDescriptors.description: If unchecked, the object will not tween into view when first created.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
description: A button that can be used for menus and most labelled buttons of a game. The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

changelog.breaking: - Buttons now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing buttons in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Events are running for the editor

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.
